Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: single seed phrase = same single address

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: HD gives you multiple address, a new address with no tx in it.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: not exactly the case with Agama

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I'm sure rewards are based on block heights

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: if a UTXO is of 10 KMD or bigger it starts counting to calculations on eligible for the rewards

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: this UTXO needs 60 confirmations to start that rewards to start from

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the calculation of the total possible rewards from this UTXO stops after about a month of block confirmations

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: on quick google search it's 43830 minutes in 1 month

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: and KMD blocks are aprox of 60 seconds

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: so I guess after 43830 blocks the rewards will not increase

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: you spend this UTXO, doesn't matter to which address, either to someone else or to one of your own, and the rewards which counts to this UTXO are send back to the same address this UTXO was originated from, sent from.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: These are the code conditions and consensus rules inside komodo

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: if you can explain there is a chance of creating extra unexpected supply through rewards, please explain

Author: AspenShredder#5419
Content: Just to make sure I am following you. Are you saying one has to sent the balance of rewards once a month from the UTXO for the process to start over and the rewards to start accumulating again?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: yes

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: before block 1,000,000 the rule was that it could not be needing spent for 1 year

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: after 1 million block, rule updated to 1 month

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the effect is that there will be more kmd transactions in network as people will be at least moving their funds once in a month, as expected behaviour

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: another effect is that with 1 year, if a person had did not move the funds for 1 year, the compound interest calculations would have given the person like around ~5.0% reward

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: and because it's more frequent compounding with every 1 month, the reward goes around to ~5.1%

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the UTXO which exists on or prior to 1 million blocks, still are under the rule of 1 year

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: those who have not spent those UTXO are still accruing the rewards

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: but as soon as the 1 year completes for those UTXOs, the reward accruing will stop

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: and they have to spend those UTXO to start accruing reward

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: when they will spend those UTXO, it will be working under new rule, so have to do the process every 1 month

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: can also do as early as after 60 minutes

Author: AspenShredder#5419
Content: I follow you

Content: but then it all depends on how much they are accruing, and if tx fee is a concern or not

Author: AspenShredder#5419
Content: So by spent you mean a transaction. Say I have 10 KMD in your Agama wallet and it starts building up interest after 60 minutes. After 1 month max you have to move those fund (transaction/spent) back to your other wallet to continue the compounding. And continue the cycle over and over. Therefore, those lost funds that were getting rewards would inherently not continue compounding until block 7,777,777,777

Content: You don't need to send it to a different wallet. You can simply make a transaction to the same address.

Content: That's what the Agama claim button does. It makes a transaction to your address.

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: Hey guys, I'm trying to call the komodod RPC call for signrawtransaction, I am getting errors though and I can't shake the feeling it's because I'm not sending the private key correctly. I struggle to find documentation on how to include more parameters than just the base tx, so any help would be appreciated

Content: I should also point out I plan on sending the private key on every request

Content:
@Emilis Please help to check this document
https://support.komodoplatform.com/a/solutions/articles/29000026631-sign-transactions-offline-and-broadcast-online-using-agama/en

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `signrawtransaction "hexstring" ( [{"txid":"id","vout":n,"scriptPubKey":"hex","redeemScript":"hex"},...] ["privatekey1",...] sighashtype )`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Emilis make sure you are giving a JSON array of privkeys, not a plain string
